pop.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: to come suddenly or unexpectedly out of or away from something
pop.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: The lid popped open and juice spilled all over the floor.
The top button popped off my shirt.
The ball popped out of Smith’s hands and onto the ground.
The egg cracked open and out popped a tiny head.
pop.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: to go somewhere for a short time
pop.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: Why don’t you pop by the next time you’re in town?
I need to pop into the drugstore for a second.
Could you pop round to the shop for some bread?
pop.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: to quickly put something somewhere, usually for a short time
pop.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: I’ll just pop these cookies into the oven.
Barry popped his head round the door to say hello.
pop.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: to make a short sound like a small explosion, or to make something do this
pop.translation[0].definitions[3].exampl: The wood sizzled and popped in the fire.
pop.translation[0].definitions[4].defini: to burst, or to make something burst, with a short explosive sound
pop.translation[0].definitions[5].defini: if your ears pop, you feel the pressure in them suddenly change, for example when you go up or down quickly in a plane
pop.translation[0].definitions[6].exampl: If you say that again, I’ll pop you one.
pop.translation[0].definitions[7].defini: to cook popcorn until it swells and bursts open, or to be cooked in this way
pop.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: modern music that is popular, especially with young people, and usually consists of simple tunes with a strong beat
pop.translation[1].definitions[1].defini: a sudden short sound like a small explosion
pop.translation[1].definitions[1].exampl: the pop of a champagne cork
The balloon went pop (=made a sudden short sound).
pop.translation[1].definitions[2].defini: a sweet drink with bubbles but no alcohol, or a glass or can of this drink
pop.translation[1].definitions[2].exampl: Can you get me a pop while you’re up?
pop.translation[1].definitions[3].defini: father – used especially when you are talking to your father
pop.translation[3].definitions[0].defini: written abbreviation for POINT OF PURCHASE
